intro: Jateorhiza palmata, commonly known as the giant panda orchid, is a rare and striking orchid species native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that resemble the black-and-white markings of a giant panda, hence its common name. The plant has a complex root system and is often found growing in shaded, humid environments. It thrives in cool, moist conditions and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its rarity and unique appearance, it is highly valued in horticulture and conservation efforts.
